p: However, specific honeys from V. amygdalina, C. macrostachyes, E. globules and B. grandiflorum have showed relatively stronger antimicrobial properties in inhibiting the growth of the tested gram negative bacteria at an averagely of 14.0 ± 0.7, 16.3 ± 0.68, 20.0 ± 0.7 and 21.1 ± 0.9 MIC (% v/v) respectively. Among the gram negative bacteria, Salmonella typhimurum and Klebsiella pneumonia become more susceptible to C. macrostachyes and V. amygdalina honeys at 10.5 ± 0.5 and 10.5 ± 0.6 MIC (% v/v) respectively.
